label: 浮世絵
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Literally, pictures of the floating world."Polychrome ukiyo-e (nishiki-e, "brocade pictures") made in Edo during the late eighteenth and nineteenth centuries were particularly renowned and were sometimes known as Edo-e ("Edo pictures") or Azuma nishiki-e ("brocade pictures of the east"). Ukiyo-e often featured portraits of famous actors or courtesans but might also include scenes from everyday life, famous places, or landscapes.［錦絵、江戸、江戸絵、東錦絵］"
